snippet: Sony, which in 2010 closed a $250 million deal with the singer's estate to acquire his back catalog and to release previously unheard recordings, has not yet said which recordings were taken when its Web site was hacked.
abstract: Sony, which in 2010 closed a $250 million deal with the singer's estate to acquire his back catalog and to release previously unheard recordings, has not yet said which recordings were taken when its Web site was hacked.

headline.main: Sony Says Michael Jackson Recordings Were Stolen From Its Site
headline.print_headline: Sony Confirms Cyber Theft of Jackson Tracks
